summary: This document is an email chain from March 6, 2019, between individuals at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and an FBI case agent. The primary purpose is logistical coordination for the transfer of a large amount of data from the FBI related to the Epstein case for uploading to a shared system.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The author of the initial substantive email, requesting coordination between a contractor and an FBI case agent to transfer Epstein case data to a shared system.

persons.name: FBI Case Agent
persons.context: Copied on the email and identified as having a large amount of Epstein case data to be provided for uploading.

persons.name: Contractor
persons.context: Addressed in the email chain (To: USANYS) [Contractor]), and is the person with whom meeting logistics (room 870) are being coordinated to presumably handle the data upload.

connections.description: The AUSA is requesting that the FBI case agent provide Epstein case data to a contractor for system upload, indicating a working law enforcement/prosecutorial relationship.
The AUSA is directing the contractor to coordinate with the FBI agent to upload case data, indicating a supervisory or contractual relationship.
The AUSA asks these two individuals to coordinate directly on the logistics of transferring the Epstein case data.

events.title: Coordination for Epstein Data Transfer
events.description: Email correspondence to arrange a meeting and the transfer of a large amount of FBI data on the Epstein case to a shared system via a contractor.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Room 870, 8th floor (implied location: One Saint Andrew's Plaza or related office building)
keyFacts: The FBI possessed a 'large amount of data' on the Epstein case as of March 2019.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively managing this data, seeking to upload it to a shared system.
Logistical coordination for data handling involved an AUSA, an FBI case agent, and a contractor.
The communication shows ongoing investigative activity related to Epstein well after his 2008 plea deal and prior to his 2019 arrest.
